page.title: 01ARTS & CRAFTS, N CREAKE
page.content: In recent years, N Creake has become the village of talented incomers. Perhaps it is the special quality of East Anglian light, together with a high and isolated situation that appeals to these people. These include a documentary film maker, a water-colour artist, and a producer of special greetings cards. The former school building now houses a small firm making three dimensional puzzles, that sell world-wide. A pine kitchen-craft business has been started in farm buildings. A quarterly magazine is edited and produced by a lady who came to live locally, and saw a need for a news letter. It has developed well beyond that point with articles and line drawings by its readers. It is distributed free, to all homes in North and South Creake.
